timeline.bodyText: Since you only want the values, just do map.values().stream()
timeline.author: bjhargrave

timeline.bodyText: Not sure this is wise. Did you check for any places which assume the presence of a bnd.info cap means the artifacts is NOT a bundle? You have changed things from a resource has either a osgi.identity or a bnd.info to where every resource has a bnd.info.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

timeline.bodyText: Is this really the formatting properties to use for POMs?
timeline.author: bjhargrave

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to say .entrySet(), MapStream.of also takes a map.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

timeline.bodyText: I would not extend File. That is super risky. I am sure it is not meant to be subclassed.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

timeline.message:
copy GAVs repository actions

Signed-off-by: Raymond Augé <raymond.auge@liferay.com>

copy GAVs repository actions

Signed-off-by: Raymond Augé <raymond.auge@liferay.com>

timeline.bodyText:
In the work I did to get the maven coordinate info into Container, I defined all the maven attr names to start with maven-:

  
    
      bnd/biz.aQute.repository/src/aQute/maven/api/Program.java
    
    
        Lines 165 to 166
      in
      7a5b449
    
    
    
    

        
          
           attrs.put("maven-groupId", group); 
        

        
          
           attrs.put("maven-artifactId", artifact); 
        
    
  



  
    
      bnd/biz.aQute.repository/src/aQute/maven/api/Revision.java
    
    
         Line 131
      in
      7a5b449
    
    
    
    

        
          
           attrs.put("maven-version", version.toString()); 
        
    
  



  
    
      bnd/biz.aQute.repository/src/aQute/maven/api/Archive.java
    
    
        Lines 248 to 249
      in
      7a5b449
    
    
    
    

        
          
           attrs.put("maven-classifier", classifier); 
        

        
          
           attrs.put("maven-extension", extension); 
        
    
  


I think we should use the same attr names here. Then is very clear where the names come from.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

replies.bodyText: Will this work via the proxy? Note that InfoCapability is created as a proxy, are you sure there is a mangling for those property names?
replies.author: rotty3000

replies.bodyText:
Why not? You are adding attributes to a builder. You can do
c.addAttributes(map);`
replies.author: bjhargrave

replies.bodyText: it's not the map usage I'm concerned with, but your recommendation to use maven-* naming. Will our proxy handle those? I guess we could fix that too I suppose...
replies.author: rotty3000

timeline.bodyText:
Instead of adding all these parameters for maven info, consider a map and passing archive.attributes()

  
    
      bnd/biz.aQute.repository/src/aQute/maven/api/Archive.java
    
    
         Line 246
      in
      7a5b449
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public Map<String, String> attributes() { 
        
    
  


Then you can just add the map to the cap attributes.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

timeline.message:
index maven metadata in repositories that support it

Signed-off-by: Raymond Augé <raymond.auge@liferay.com>

context sensitive drag and drop GAVs onto existing editors; bnd, bndrun, gradle, maven

alternate syntax are available by pressing the <alt> keep before drag starts

Signed-off-by: Raymond Augé <raymond.auge@liferay.com>

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps we should modify the BndEditor so that you don't have to do this.  The BndEditor could override the getAdapter method and return the styledText where someone queries for Control.class
timeline.author: gamerson

timeline.bodyText: BndEditor would need to add getAdapter support for Control.class for this to properly unmerge the dropTarget.
timeline.author: gamerson
